name: Bowman v. Press Publishing Company, Appellant

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Sohaeper, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Bowman v. Press Publishing Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The questions involved in this appeal are fully and correctly disposed of in the opinion of the court below by Judge Patterson.
The judgment is affirmed on that opinion.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William H. Eckert, with Mm David B. Buerger, of Smith, Buchanan, Scott & Gordon, for appellant.
Clyde A. Armstrong, of Thorp, Bostwick, Reed & Armstrong, for appellee, was not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Bowman v. Press Publishing Company, Appellant.
Argued October 10, 1934.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Sohaeper, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
William H. Eckert, with Mm David B. Buerger, of Smith, Buchanan, Scott & Gordon, for appellant.
Clyde A. Armstrong, of Thorp, Bostwick, Reed & Armstrong, for appellee, was not heard.
November 26, 1934:
